qas.question: Who controlled musical institutions before the 19th century?
Composers and musicians began to construct lives independent of what in the 19th century?
What class increased it's interest in music during the 19th century?
What instrument became widely popular in the middle class in the 19th century?
The 19th century marks the foundation of many what?

context: In the 19th century, musical institutions emerged from the control of <a0_0>wealthy patrons<a0_0/>, as composers and musicians could construct lives independent of <a1_0>the nobility<a1_0/>. Increasing interest in music by the growing <a2_0>middle classes<a2_0/> throughout western Europe spurred the creation of organizations for the teaching, performance, and preservation of music. <a3_0>The piano<a3_0/>, which achieved its modern construction in this era (in part due to industrial advances in metallurgy) became widely popular with the middle class, whose demands for the instrument spurred a large number of piano builders. Many <a4_0>symphony orchestras<a4_0/> date their founding to this era. Some musicians and composers were the stars of the day; some, like Franz Liszt and Niccolò Paganini, fulfilled both roles.
